Coalescent models

class phasegen.coalescent_models.CoalescentModel

Bases: ABC

Abstract class for coalescent models.

get_rate(s1: int, s2: int)

Get rate for a merger collapsing k1 lineages into k2 lineages.

Parameters:

  • s1 (int) – Number of lineages in the first state.

  • s2 (int) – Number of lineages in the second state.

Return type:

float

Returns:

The rate.

get_rate_block_counting(n: int, s1: numpy.ndarray, s2: numpy.ndarray)

Get (positive) rate between two block counting states. \({ (a_1,...,a_n) \in \mathbb{Z}^+ : \sum_{i=1}^{n} a_i = n \}\).

Parameters:

  • n (int) – Number of lineages.

  • s1 (ndarray) – Sample configuration 1.

  • s2 (ndarray) – Sample configuration 2.

Return type:

float

Returns:

The rate.

class phasegen.coalescent_models.StandardCoalescent

Bases: CoalescentModel

Standard (Kingman) coalescent model. Refer to Msprime docs for more information.

class phasegen.coalescent_models.BetaCoalescent(alpha: float, scale_time: bool = True)

Bases: CoalescentModel

Beta coalescent model. Refer to Msprime docs for more information.

TODO disagrees with Msprime for large values of alpha

__init__(alpha: float, scale_time: bool = True)

Initialize the beta coalescent model.

Parameters:

  • alpha (float) – The alpha parameter of the beta coalescent model.

  • scale_time (bool) – Whether to scale coalescence time as described in Msprime docs. If False, the timescale is set to N.

scale_time: bool

Whether to scale coalescence time

alpha: float

The alpha parameter of the beta coalescent model.

  • s2 (int) – Number of lineages in the second state.

get_rate_block_counting(n: int, s1: numpy.ndarray, s2: numpy.ndarray)

Get (positive) rate between two block counting states. \({ (a_1,...,a_n) \in \mathbb{Z}^+ : \sum_{i=1}^{n} a_i = n \}\).

class phasegen.coalescent_models.DiracCoalescent(psi: float, c: float, scale_time: bool = True)

Bases: CoalescentModel

Dirac coalescent model. Refer to Msprime docs for more information.

TODO shorter SFS bins than msprime

__init__(psi: float, c: float, scale_time: bool = True)

Initialize the Dirac coalescent model.

Parameters:

  • psi (float) – The fraction of the population replaced by offspring in one large reproduction event

  • c (float) – The rate of potential multiple merger events.

  • scale_time (bool) – Whether to scale coalescence time as described in Msprime docs. If False, the timescale is set to N.

psi

The fraction of the population replaced by offspring in one large reproduction event

c

The rate of potential multiple merger events.

scale_time: bool

Whether to scale coalescence time

Get rate for a merger collapsing k1 lineages into k2 lineages.

Parameters:

  • s1 (int) – Number of lineages in the first state.

  • s2 (int) – Number of lineages in the second state.

Return type:

float

Returns:

The rate.

get_rate_block_counting(n: int, s1: numpy.ndarray, s2: numpy.ndarray)

Get (positive) rate between two block counting states. \({ (a_1,...,a_n) \in \mathbb{Z}^+ : \sum_{i=1}^{n} a_i = n \}\).

Parameters:

  • s2 (ndarray) – Sample configuration 2.
